Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: Draws a detailed and accurate representation of a chosen land or water habitat, such as a forest or a pond.
Illustrates a wide variety of plants, including trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants, relevant to the selected habitat.
Includes a diverse range of animals, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams, that are appropriate for the habitat depicted.
Shows differences and similarities between two different habitats effectively by including distinct and overlapping species.
Uses patterns and labels in the drawing to accurately represent the diversity and distribution of plant and animal life across different habitats.
Attempts to depict interactions, such as predator-prey relationships or symbiotic interactions, though not the focus, may be attempted with some success.
CANNOT: May occasionally omit a label or mislabel a less familiar species (student might not know the specific name of all organisms drawn).
Might infrequently depict an organism out of context for the specific habitat chosen (might draw a saltwater fish in a freshwater habitat).
